subject: Pedal pro Plus issues
description_text:
Hi!

I bought a set of pedal pro plus and enjoyed the pedals very much, but
there is a little issue regarding the input in game and in the software
calibration. There are some input spikes when pressing the pedals (Brake
and Throttle in my case), like spikes related to grounding issues. I' ve
checked the wire ground to the module controller, and it is ok!..Using the
Software manager 1.8.0 (tried to use Software v4 calibration tool but there
is a huge deadzone and imprecise input). Can this issue be related to
hardware or software? Is there any firmware update to solve this problem?

Thank you very much for your help!

conversations.body_text: Hi paulo vitor ferraz ribeiro,  Could you please provide some photos of the installation and a video showing the software in use to help explain the issue? This will allow me to assist you more quickly and effectively.

Hi!      I've sent  a couple of videos showing the issue in game and in software,  becomes more evident  in game  than in software. (some times the spikes goes for more than 1% of input).

Hi paulo vitor ferraz ribeiro,     I see that you've connected the green ground wire, but the black paint might be causing poor contact. It’s recommended to remove some of the paint at the contact point to ensure proper grounding with the metal surface.  Also, are you using a Fanatec or Simagic base? These bases can sometimes cause interference with other devices. To improve stability, it's best to ensure that both the base and the PC are properly connected to the household ground. With proper grounding, the signal should remain stable without fluctuations.

Thank you for help.

I'm using a Cammus C5 DD wheel. Already removed some paint to make a better
contact.Unfortunately I don't have household ground. Can you send please a
recovery file download? I can access anymore in site.

Hi paulo vitor ferraz ribeiro,     For the Pro Plus, you can update directly by going to the update interface → Manual Firmware Update → navigate to the “pedals-firmware” folder → then the “pedals” folder → and select the “plus.sfu” file.
